I might be a little behind on the posts so if I miss anything could someone 
please point it out for me?

* Iron Raptor stood facting Firedrill, moving one of her hands behind her to 
deactivate the 3D scan of the CF and all the surrounding area. There was no 
point to the scan now, except for the fact that she read a little amount of 
shock from Prowl when he looked over security, wondering to herself what was 
wrong.
The next thing she knew Angel Prime had entered and room, told her he was 
leaving and left, then both Epyon and Prowl ran out towards the front of the 
ship.
She sighed. What was wrong now?
Without even hesitation Iron Raptor followed, though slower then any of the 
others.
She was in no hurry to find out what the problem was now, but she knew that 
it must be important for Prowl to get involved.
Leaving Firedrill to follow her if he pleased, she walked through the walls 
of the CF, running a hand along them from time to time until the doors of 
the CF came into view.
From there she walked alone, nothing destracting her as the doors drew 
closer. Finally, she paused at them and they both opened for her, walking 
past them as if there was nothing wrong and she was just coming out for a 
breath of fresh air.
And from there there was more then just the landscape to look at, Maximals 
of all sorts had gathered around some other transformer, but one that was, 
for sure, no Maximal.
Iron Raptor narrowed her eyes, her voice clear and carried over everyone 
elses.*

" What's going on here?!"


...................................................

* Slick the water running from her form, Sublime stepped from the sea and 
onto the land, thinking how strange it was to fee earth under her feet 
instead of the smoothness of the liquid she had just came from.
Shaking herself off a bit she set out towards her destination, the Maximal 
Base.(CF)
There was no telling how the faction would react to meeting her and there 
was no telling how she would feel about meeting them. BUT she was determined 
to make a proper and complete study on them, just like the remainder of the 
group was supposed to do with the factions they'd hooked up with.
But from here on there was no real amount of water that she could soak in 
until she reached the ship, making this seem like a very uncomfortable 
quest.
But she was sure that the faction she was heading too had water, enough for 
her to soak in for hours.
Sublime looked back over her shoulder, half turning and looking out at the 
sea longingly. The smooth surface reflecting the last of the sun's rays as 
evening closed in.
She would miss the sea, but she would return. She would always return.
And with that she turned back towards the land, setting out towards the 
forests and wood, until she came to the grasslands that held the CF.
But, just to speed up the process, her signature sent out a destress beacon 
to all Maximal foces.*
